ygData.messageBody:
On Fri, 17 Sep 1999 firehawk@... wrote:
>
> What other class has had their spell deliberatly placed as
> lesser value? Our cancelling SOW was a fluke.. SoW
> overpowering Accel was not an accident. And WHY would you
> prefer SOW to Accel? Obviously outdoors you would not
> since Accel is far faster especially as the bard playing
> grows. In our desire to not fall into the morrass of me

I really wish they'd just fix this right, and have the game
check for other active movement spell effects when one
expires. If two are in conflict, the faster takes precedence
(with the exception of root/snare/chain). If someone has SoW
on him and a bard in his group plays a faster Accelerando, he
should get the Accelerando boost. If he drops out of song
range, he should drop back down to SoW speed.

> I would like to see the quest system fixed.. I'd like to
> see some more special items for bards. I'd like to see

I too would like to see some more special items. Right now
the only bard-specific items are instruments, one of which
comes from Nagafen the dragon, one which comes from a L30ish
mob in Mistmoore, and the rest of which are no different from
store bought instruments. Oh, and the PoF items, not that any
bard is going to be getting them soon.

> some more useful songs. And I'ld like to see them stop
> nerfing us without reguard to the results. I won't even
> get into balance, as right now I feel we are underbalanced
> now and others seem to think we are just fine. Anyway

In terms of balance, I think we're still pretty well balanced.
I'd like to see us get either another defensive skill, or the
cap on dodge raised to 200. The defensive skills are dodge,
block, parry, and riposte. Because we're not supposed to be
full tanks, we only get one out of four. And then for some
strange reason the one we get is capped at half what the other
tanks get? That puts our defensive ability closer to casters
than to tanks. In fact I'll need to ask my cleric friends
what the cap on their dodge skill is. I have the sinking
feeling they're just as good at tanking as we are (better
even since they're usually using a shield).

--
John H. Kim
